<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e20e68b40d9572393bb3577d6a0b52e960950b57|patch 8.2.0053: windowsversion() does not always return the right value>
patch 8.2.0053: windowsversion() does not always return the right value

Problem:    windowsversion() does not always return the right value.
Solution:   Add a compatibility section in the manifest. (Ken Takata,
            closes #5407)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0053: windowsversion() does not always return the right value · vim/vim@e20e68b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0053: windowsversion() does not always return the right value · vim/vim@e20e68b
attachments.text: Problem: windowsversion() does not always return the right value. Solution: Add a compatibility section in the manifest. (Ken Takata, closes #5407)

patch 8.2.0054: :diffget and :diffput don't have good completion

Problem:    :diffget and :diffput don't have good completion.
Solution:   Add proper completion. (Dominique Pelle, closes #5409)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/257a396879ff67a0482841a39237f30a8e1e27c5|patch 8.2.0055: cannot use ":gui" in vimrc with VIMDLL enabled>
patch 8.2.0055: cannot use ":gui" in vimrc with VIMDLL enabled

Problem:    Cannot use ":gui" in vimrc with VIMDLL enabled.
Solution:   Change the logic, check "gui.starting". (Ken Takata, closes #5408)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0055: cannot use ":gui" in vimrc with VIMDLL enabled · vim/vim@257a396
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0055: cannot use ":gui" in vimrc with VIMDLL enabled · vim/vim@257a396
attachments.text: Problem: Cannot use ":gui" in vimrc with VIMDLL enabled. Solution: Change the logic, check "gui.starting". (Ken Takata, closes #5408)
